intro: Armeria splendens, commonly known as the splendour thrift, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern South America. It is a low-growing perennial that produces dense clusters of bright white or pink flowers. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and is well adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It thrives in full sun and is often found in coastal dunes and rocky habitats. Its showy blooms make it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
